definition: to decline/to fall/to drop/to falter/a decline/recession (in economics)
to decline/to wane/to become weak or feeble
to retreat/to decline/to move back/to withdraw

sentences.english: On the whole, average weekly hours are far below their pre-recession level.
sentences.chinese: 整體而言，周平均工作時間比起衰退前大幅下滑。

sentences.english: When Bush 41 talked about the economy, that was the beginning of the downward spiral.
sentences.chinese: 老布什談論經濟的時候，是經濟衰退的開始。

sentences.english: The global recession has hit Kumi's hometown hard.
sentences.chinese: 全球的經濟衰退給木村的家鄉造成了很大的衝擊。

sentences.english: Our powers decay in old age. ;
sentences.chinese: 我們的膂力在年夜哥時衰退。

sentences.english: But after that period, the tea economy is in the recession.
sentences.chinese: 但自唐中後期以後，茶業經濟逐步呈現出衰退趨勢。

sentences.english: S. could be thrown back into recession.
sentences.chinese: 而美國可以後仰陷入衰退。

sentences.english: Then that brings us to the 2008 recession.
sentences.chinese: 之後，那次危機導致了08年的經濟衰退。

sentences.english: And sometimes, it seems your community has faded when it is simply taking a breather.
sentences.chinese: 有時社區可能需要緩一緩勁，但您卻認爲它衰退了。

sentences.english: With the development of society , Menyin showed a declining tendency.
sentences.chinese: 門蔭制隨着社會的發展，出現衰退的趨勢。

sentences.english: THE bubble that caused a global recession has been a long time deflating.
sentences.chinese: 引發全球經濟衰退的泡沫就是長期的通貨緊縮。

sentences.english: AZUZ: The recession affected how we spend money.
sentences.chinese: 這次經濟衰退影響了我們的消費方式。

sentences.english: Many small firms did not weather the storm of the recession.
sentences.chinese: 許多小公司沒能經受住這次經濟衰退的風波。
不斷的壓力將使心志衰退。

sentences.english: I don't see a double dip... The recovery is on track.
sentences.chinese: 我不覺得是雙谷衰退，經濟復甦已經走上正軌。

sentences.english: That all sounds especially alluring in a recession.
sentences.chinese: 這些在如今經濟衰退時聽起來都相當誘人。

sentences.english: US defence spending is levelling off and appears to be on the brink of a potentially significant downturn.
sentences.chinese: 美國國防預算正在下降並顯現出處在重大衰退的邊緣。

definition: to fall/to drop/to decline/to deteriorate/to go downhill
to wither/to dry up (of a plant)/to atrophy (of muscle, social custom etc)
to decline/to drop/to fall/to go down/to decrease
